page.title: 14 Farming
page.content: Local economy is dominated by agriculture. Land is in Less Favoured area, so farmers are eligible for full livestock subsidies. Most farmers have common grazing rights and are members of Mynydd Mallaen Graziers Assoc. Cil-y-cwm is livestock rearing area, predominantly sheep, but also suckler cows, dairy herd and some horses. Some farmers supplement income by providing camp sitse and offering Bed and Breakfast accommodation. Smaller farms have amalgamated into larger units, several of farmhouses have been sold with small parcels of land or have been let as holiday cottages. Some of the less viable farms subcontract labour.Crops-mainly grass,some hay,mostly silage, with Big Bale silage on the increase. No cereals grown. Only root crop is rape for lamb fattening.
